item.title: #1: January 02, 2007
item.description:
I hope you all enjoyed the holidays. I believe this is the last of the pre-taped shows, so maybe next week will be live again. Please visit the official site for more track information. In case you haven't noticed yet (or read the previous post), I've cleaned up the Fanatic! Fantasies section. Anything you find there now is available for download directly. I have a few older posts pending and I will add those as soon as I get the files.

Part One * Part Two * Part Three * Part Four

01. Black Flag - Fix Me
02. Viletones – Rebel
03. Ramones - Rockaway Beach
04. Iggy And The Stooges - Tight Pants
05. The Dregs - I'm Insane
06. Lightnin' Hopkins - Happy New Year
07. Raymond Scott - New Year's Eve In A Haunted House
08. Woody Guthrie - Los Angeles New Year's Flood
09. Isaac Hayes - The Mistletoe And Me
10. Tenor Saw - Ring The Alarm (Live)
11. The Clash – Cheat

13. Generation X - Day By Day

22. Wire - Two People In A Room
23. The Screamer – Infant Son
24. Devo – Shout (E-Z Listening version)

item.title: #2: January 9, 2007 - Thanks Stuart!
item.description:
Thank you to Stuart for sending the first half of the show. I was having connection problems and it took about half the show to get it going again. This week was not a live show, but still a good one. Please visit the official site for the track info. Be sure to check out the Fanatic!Fantasies section. There's a great set there from Dick that includes a rare Pink Floyd track. He's also included track notes with his set, so don't miss out. More of the older sets have been added as well.

Part One * Part Two * Part Three * Part Four

01. X - Johnny Hit And Run Paulene
02. Birthday Party - Blast Off
03. The Fall - So Called Dangerous
04. Public Image Ltd. - Public Image
05. Public Enemy - Public Enemy #1 (Demo)
06. The Ruts – Backbiter

08. Parliament - Mr. Wiggles
09. The Inspirations - You Know What I Mean
10. Sleater-Kinney - Night Light

item.title: #3: January 16, 2007
item.description:
According to the official site, this is the last of the pre-taped shows. Next week should be a brand new live broadcast. For those of you who noticed a new link on this site over the weekend only to find that it went nowhere, sorry! It's fixed now. It's the link labeled "mindriot & black coffee" and it takes you to the blogger page of our fellow fanatic Patrick's two radio shows out of Minturn, Colorado.

And now for a very special shout out to an Aussie tyke who could very well be the youngest fanatic-in-training out there. Happy 1st Birthday, Sam! Sam's proud papa is the creator of the justdamnedpunk podcast. Check it out, rock out to some awesome punk, and wish little Sam a happy birthday!

Part One * Part Two * Part Three * Part Four

01. Gunung Jati Ensemble Of Tegas - Gambang Kuta
02. Laurie Anderson - Sharkey's Night
03. Dr. Alimantado - Mash It Up
04. David Bowie - Look Back In Anger
05. Betty Davis - Don't Call Her No Tramp
06. Television – Venus
07. The Fall - Green Eyed Loco Man
08. James Brown - There It Is (parts 1&2)
09. Buzzcocks - Harmony in My Head
10. Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds - Red Right Hand

item.title: #4: January 23, 2007 - UPDATED 01/31/07
item.description:
[UPDATE: Stuart sent in a terrestrial recording of the first few minutes so we can hear what the web stream was trying to cover with a commercial. I spliced it into the recording I had for part one. The link below is for the new file, if you want to redownload it. There was some static, especially in the first few seconds, and I monkeyed around with the sound a bit so it sounds a little weird. You can really tell where the splices are but it's talking and not music, so it's not too bad. Thanks again, Stuart!]

Thanks to everyone at 21361 for being nice to me today and not mistaking me for a kook. And just in case any of you know the nut out there that thinks Henry's tattoos are talking to them, please let them know that I hope the tattoos are telling them to lay off the crack for a while. Moving on.... I put a link up for the West Memphis Three website. Many of you already know about it, but for those of you who don't please check it out. This week's show is in 3 parts because the first hour was commercial-free and I didn't want to chop it up.

Part One (updated) * Part Two * Part Three

01. The Stains - Gang Related Death
02. Ahmad Muhammad Ahmad - Torab-Taqsim Nay
03. James "Iron Head" Baker - Black Betty
04. Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds - Black Betty
05. Kim Salmon & the Surrealists – Radiation

08. Nikki Sudden And Rowland S. Howard - Sob Story

10. Gene Defcon – Toss That Fish Back
